sections.text: Penn’s MPH prepares professionals to advance population health through training in epidemiology, biostatistics, health policy, and community practice.

items: Concentrations such as Global Health, Health Policy, or One Health (as offered)
sections.text: The curriculum integrates core public health competencies with a concentration, applied practice, and a culminating capstone or thesis.

items: Completion of required credits and practice components
Bachelor’s degree and application materials per program
For international applicants: TOEFL/IELTS as applicable
sections.text: Students must meet credit, practice, and culminating experience requirements; admissions follow Penn Medicine’s MPH policies.
Graduates work in public health agencies, healthcare systems, NGOs, and research organizations.
